docs.text: being the self-proclaimed professional film critic that i am , i am somewhat embarrassed to admit that i had not seen lawrence of arabia ( coming soon to dvd ) until only recently .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: after all , it's considered by just about everyone to be the masterpiece epic of director david lean , who also directed films such as bridge on the river kwai , and doctor zhivago .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: so one day , a friend of mine loaned me a copy of the video and i sat down and watched it .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i was initially skeptical that something made almost 40 years ago would be able to keep my attention for the butt-numbing 3 1/2 hours of its duration .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but now i fully understand why this has become the film that other epic films are judged against -- the winner of seven academy awards in 1963 for best picture , director , editing , cinematography , art direction , music , and sound .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: after watching the film again , i am convinced that it is simply one of the finest works of cinematic genius to ever illuminate the big screen .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: based on the autobiographical writing of british officer t . e .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: lawrence during world war i , lawrence of arabia depicts lawrence ( played by then-unknown actor peter o'toole ) as a lieutenant lacking any sort of military discipline whatsoever .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: bored with his assignment of coloring maps for the british army in a dimly lit headquarters building , lawrence jumps at the opportunity to be re-assigned as an observer for an arabian prince fighting against the turkish army .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: lawrence quickly sees just how caring and great these desert dwelling people can be and ends up rallying the various tribes together to fight the turks and help the british turn the tide of world war i .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: shot in panavision's famed super 70mm format , the film beautifully illustrates the definition of the word epic .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is absolutely breathtaking .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: using stunning cinematography , costuming , and direction , shot in the most uninhabitable location on the face of the earth , i can only imagine what it must have been like to sit in a theater in 1962 and watch this story unfold before my eyes .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: every shot is choreographed as a portrait -- a living tribute to a great land .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: david lean put his reputation on the line to get this film completed , and the fact that it was even greenlit in the first place says something about the ideology of the motion picture industry at the time , a far cry from its pathetic , uncreative existence today .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: after watching the film , the first thing that came to my mind was , " i've got to do a remake of this film ! "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but then i thought about trying to pitch the idea to a modern-day movie executive : " okay , it's going to be almost four hours long and shot over three months on location in the sahara desert .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: we are going to need to blow up a full-size train because computer-generated effects probably wont do it justice .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and we are not going to use any big stars , and won't have any female actors since there's no love story . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: yes , my friends , the velvet curtain fell on the golden-era of hollywood a long time ago .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but at least we still have the proof to show all would-be producers and directors out there just how good a film can be .
docs.label: positive
